title: Video: Syria Rebels Inside Presidential Palace, Tear Assad Family Portraits
content: Islamist-led rebels declared they had taken Damascus in a lightning offensive on Sunday, sending President Bashar al-Assad fleeing and ending five decades of Baath rule in Syria.
summary: Islamist-led rebels declared they had taken Damascus in a lightning offensive on Sunday, sending President Bashar al-Assad fleeing and ending five decades of Baath rule in Syria.

title: Storm Darragh: 2 Dead As Heavy Rain, Winds Wrecks Havoc In UK
content: Tens of thousands of homes across the UK were left without power on Saturday and two people were killed after Storm Darragh hit the country with strong winds and caused pre-Christmas travel disruption.
summary: Tens of thousands of homes across the UK were left without power on Saturday and two people were killed after Storm Darragh hit the country with strong winds and caused pre-Christmas travel disruption.

title: After Assad's Fall, Syrian Opposition Flag Unfurled At Athens Embassy
content: The Syrian opposition flag was unfurled at the Syrian embassy in Athens on Sunday, hours after Islamist-led rebels declared they had taken Damascus, ending the rule of President Bashar al-Assad.
summary: The Syrian opposition flag was unfurled at the Syrian embassy in Athens on Sunday, hours after Islamist-led rebels declared they had taken Damascus, ending the rule of President Bashar al-Assad.

title: Indian-Origin Man, 20, Shot Dead In Canada, 2nd Death Within A Week
content: Harshandeep Singh, a 20-year-old Indian-origin man, working as a security guard in Canada, was shot dead on Friday, the Police said.
summary: Harshandeep Singh, a 20-year-old Indian-origin man, working as a security guard in Canada, was shot dead on Friday, the Police said.

title: South Korean Oppn Plans New Impeachment Push To Oust President: Top Points
content: South Korea's leadership crisis deepened on Sunday as the country's main opposition party said that it would try again to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol after his short-lived attempt to impose martial law. Mr Yoon averted impeachment late Saturday.
summary: South Korea's leadership crisis deepened on Sunday as the country's main opposition party said that it would try again to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol after his short-lived attempt to impose martial law. Mr Yoon averted impeachment late Saturday.

title: How World Leaders Reacted To Downfall Of Bashar Al-Assad's Rule In Syria
content: Syria's army command notified officers on Sunday that President Bashar al-Assad's 24-year authoritarian rule has ended.
summary: Syria's army command notified officers on Sunday that President Bashar al-Assad's 24-year authoritarian rule has ended.

title: Bashar Al-Assad Out, Rebels Take Over: What Next For Syria And Its People
content: Syria's future hinges on uncertainty after the abrupt fall of President Bashar al-Assad's regime. Once thought unassailable, Assad's rule collapsed under the pressure of a rapid offensive led by a group called Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS).
summary: Syria's future hinges on uncertainty after the abrupt fall of President Bashar al-Assad's regime. Once thought unassailable, Assad's rule collapsed under the pressure of a rapid offensive led by a group called Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS).

title: "Failing To...": S Korea's Interior Minister Resigns Over Martial Law Fiasco
content: South Korea's interior minister resigned on Sunday following the declaration of martial law that plunged the country into turmoil.
summary: South Korea's interior minister resigned on Sunday following the declaration of martial law that plunged the country into turmoil.

title: Mass Hangings, Torture That Destroyed Hope: Syria's 'Human Slaughterhouse'
content: As a 13-year-old rebellion overthrew the Bashar al-Assad regime in Syria, the rebels released prisoners held up for years in government prisons near Damascus, Hama and Aleppo. Among these prisons, the most notorious is Saydnaya
summary: As a 13-year-old rebellion overthrew the Bashar al-Assad regime in Syria, the rebels released prisoners held up for years in government prisons near Damascus, Hama and Aleppo. Among these prisons, the most notorious is Saydnaya

title: Meet George Jacob Koovakad, Indian Priest Elevated To Cardinal By The Pope
content: George Jacob Koovakad, 51, was officially inducted during a ceremony at St. Peter's Basilica, attended by clergy and dignitaries from around the world.

title: United Airlines Offers Free 'Fantasy Flights' To See Santa At North Pole
content: Children with cancer or who have been orphaned by the loss of someone on active duty are taken aboard the short flight to the fantasy land.

title: The Who's Who Of Al-Assads: Inside Syria's Most Powerful Family
content: Behind the smoke and chaos of Syria's ongoing turmoil, the Al-Assad family stands as the untouchable core -- a dynasty that has moulded the country's fate for over half a century. At the centre is Bashar al-Assad.
summary: Behind the smoke and chaos of Syria's ongoing turmoil, the Al-Assad family stands as the untouchable core -- a dynasty that has moulded the country's fate for over half a century. At the centre is Bashar al-Assad.

title: The Rise Of Ba'ath Party And How It Solidified Its Hold On Syria
content: Since Hafez al-Assad seized power in 1971, Syria's political structure has been dominated by three key pillars: the Ba'ath Party, the Alawite minority, and the Syrian Army.
summary: Since Hafez al-Assad seized power in 1971, Syria's political structure has been dominated by three key pillars: the Ba'ath Party, the Alawite minority, and the Syrian Army.

title: Elon Musk's Grok AI Chatbot Now Free For All Users, But Has Limits
content: Elon Musk's X (formerly known as Twitter) has rolled out a free, limited-tier version of its AI chatbot, Grok, in a move to broaden its user base.
summary: Elon Musk's X (formerly known as Twitter) has rolled out a free, limited-tier version of its AI chatbot, Grok, in a move to broaden its user base.

title: How A Syrian Teen Triggered Al-Assad's Fall With Graffiti 13 Years Ago
content: In early 2011, in the streets of Daraa, southern Syria, a teenager's rebellious act against an authoritarian regime triggered a civil war that reshaped the country's destiny.
summary: In early 2011, in the streets of Daraa, southern Syria, a teenager's rebellious act against an authoritarian regime triggered a civil war that reshaped the country's destiny.

title: Where Is Bashar Al-Assad? Questions Over Syrian President's Whereabouts
content: A Syria war monitor said that President Bashar al-Assad has left the country, after losing swathes of territory to a lightning offensive led by an Islamist-led rebel coalition that said it entered Damascus on Sunday.
summary: A Syria war monitor said that President Bashar al-Assad has left the country, after losing swathes of territory to a lightning offensive led by an Islamist-led rebel coalition that said it entered Damascus on Sunday.

title: Video: Statues Of Bashar Al-Assad's Father Dragged Through Syria Roads
content: As Syrian President Bashar Al Assad fled the country amid a regime change and rebel forces moved in, statues of his father and former President Hafez Al-Assad in and around the capital were pulled down by protesters welcoming the rebel fighters.
summary: As Syrian President Bashar Al Assad fled the country amid a regime change and rebel forces moved in, statues of his father and former President Hafez Al-Assad in and around the capital were pulled down by protesters welcoming the rebel fighters.
